metadata.title: CVE-2016-6160 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
tcprewrite in tcpreplay before 4.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (segmentation fault) via a large frame, a related issueto CVE-2017-14266.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpreplay - 3.4.4-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpreplay package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.4-3').
